results.title: The Date
results.creator_credit: Christina Crowley and O D N Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Acquaintance Rape”.
A young girl with an older boy come home after a date. They play out what they think of each other in their minds. The young man wants to go to bed with her, while she’s thinking about what a nice guy he is. She rejects him when he makes a pass at her. They argue, he slaps her and begins to harass her. The film stops there providing food for thought on the subject of sexual violence/sexual harassment.

results.title: The Darwin story
results.creator_credit: Jack Gulley, Australian Broadcasting Commission and Jim Revitt
results.brief_description: Captures the devastation caused to the city of Darwin by Cyclone Tracy on 24th and 25th December 1974. It is described by Mike Hayes, an ABC reporter who experienced the cyclone and shows the massive emergency operation that followed. Included are comments by the Prime Minister of the time, Gough Whitlam, as well as statements by Dr. Jim Cairns, and Major-General Alan Stretton. Photography by Keith Bushnal; script by Ivan Chapman; editing by Lee Fewings, Ashley Smith and Alec Cullen; sound by Roger Doyle; narration by James Dibble.

results.title: The Darra dogs
results.brief_description: Haunted by the dogs of his childhood, Dennis Tupicoff tries to explain his feelings about dogs to his 4 year old daughter. Dennis and his brothers grew up in Darra, then an industrial suburb of Brisbane where every household seemed to have a dog. Some were friends who shared their lives and explorations while others were “hounds from hell” prowling though the neighbourhood. The Darra Dogs is a memorial to the mortal terrors of childhood, the sadness of death and loss and, of course, to the dogs themselves.

results.title: The Darra dogs
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission and Dennis Tupicoff
results.brief_description: Haunted by the dogs of his childhood, Dennis Tupicoff tries to explain his feelings about dogs to his young daughter. With the use of a strong animation style Tupicoff tells the story of his youth in Darra, then an industrial suburb of Brisbane, where every household seemed to have a dog. Some dogs were friends that shared their lives and then sadly disappeared or were victims of early deaths as a result of disease or cars. Others were huge and savage and seemed to stalk through their days spreading fear as they lived long and dangerous lives. This is a memorial film to the terrors of childhood, the insecurities, the sadness of death and loss, and to the dogs themselves.

results.title: The Darling does = Les Biches [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Andre Genoves, Les Films La Boetie, Alexandra and Claude Chabrol
results.brief_description: A psychological thriller involving a triangle between a predatory older woman, Frederique, a young waif, ‘Why’, and Paul, an architect. Interest lies in the cool elegance of the surfaces, the schematic complexity of the human relationships with their changing combinations of homosexual and heterosexual attraction, and the special sense of the unspoken shifts in those relationships. The classical symmetry and spareness of Chabrol’s mise-en-scene is reminiscent of Fritz Lang’s cinema. In this geometry of human relationships the triangle ultimately becomes a circle as one personality ‘consumes’ another. This is the first of the psychological dramas constituting Chabrol’s mature phase. Cast includes Stephane Audran, Jean-Louis Trintignant and Jacqueline Tassard. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Darling buds of May: Christmas is coming
results.creator_credit: Peter Norris, Yorkshire Television, ITV and David Giles
results.brief_description: An air of excited anticipation is everywhere as Pop trims the huge tree with tinsel and lights while the rest of the family festoon the house with paper chains and Christmas baubles. It’s a time of peace and goodwill to all men and everything should be right with the world. For some in the village, however, there’s little sign of either as Christmas draws near. The Larkins, though, are about to bring happiness to at least one family and put smiles on the faces of two sad little children, with the timely assistance of a certain red-robed and whiskered old gentleman. It’s a time for celebration and everyone is invited to share a truly ‘perfick’ Christmas with the Larkins. Based on the books by H. E. Bates.

results.title: The Darkroom
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Photographer Jerry Burchfield demonstrates the basic steps in developing and printing photographs. He discusses photograms, dodging, burning in, toning, solarization and multiple printing.

results.title: The Dark woods = Les Bois noirs
results.creator_credit: Eric Heumann, Paradis Films, Mondex Films, FR3 Films, Generale d'Images and Jacques Deray
results.brief_description: After a whirlwind romance, Violette, an unemployed actress agrees on impulse to marry Gustave, a charming aristocrat. After the couple returns to Gustave’s estate - an old chateau surrounded by forests, Violette begins to realise that beneath her groom’s charming exterior lies an undreamt of savagery. When she finds herself drawn to his brother, Bastien, Gustave is overcome by jealousy and turns to violence. In French with English subtitles. Cast includes Beatrice Dalle, Philippe Volter and Stephane Freiss.

results.title: The Dark gate
results.creator_credit: David Dortort, Robert Gordon and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bonanza”.
In this episode from Season Two of ‘Bonanza’ (first screened 3/4/61), Adam is puzzled by the bizarre behaviour of his longtime friend and neighbour but is powerless to help him. When Ross becomes physically violent with his wife, Adam removes her from the home to give Ross time to come to his senses. However, Ross’ behavior grows increasingly worse and he progresses to robbery and murder. Cast includes Lorne Greene, Michael Landon, Dan Blocker, Pernell Roberts and James Coburn.
